medical_history.chief_complaint: Stage IV nonâ€“small-cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with neurological symptoms.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 5 months prior with headaches, followed by left-sided weakness, leftward drift while walking, and mild fatigue. Neurological symptoms progressed to include left-sided facial droop, dragging of the left foot, generalized weakness, decreased sensation on the left side, and difficulty grasping objects with the left hand.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of hyperlipidemia and depression; previously underwent inguinal hernia repair, hemorrhoidectomy, and appendectomy.

medical_history.social_history: Right-handed, married, worked in an office, consumed alcohol in moderation, and had never smoked.
